snippet: The Nikkei index has fallen 8.9 percent since the start of the year, despite a rise on Tuesday, underlining worry that Japan’s economic acceleration could dissipate.
lead_paragraph: The Nikkei index has fallen 8.9 percent since the start of the year, despite a rise on Tuesday, underlining worry that Japan’s economic acceleration could dissipate.

headline.main: With Market Gyrations, Japanese Stocks Lose Darling Status
headline.print_headline: With Market Gyrations, Japanese Stocks Lose Darling Status
